did.unittitle: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Public Safety, DATES

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Public Safety, DATES. [Cite accession number], State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 44680 transferred by Martha Hazelgrove, Office of the Secretary of Public Safety, 1111 E. Broad Street, Richmond, Virginia, 12 January 2010.
Accession 44702 transferred by the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety, 14 January 2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

item.emph: Series I. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Assigned State Agencies, 1999-2010
Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, DATES

list.item: Subseries C. Records of Deputy Secretary Barry Green, 1998-2005
Subseries D. Records of Assistant Secretary Dawn Smith, DATES

item.emph: Series III. Decision Memoranda and Briefs, DATES
Series V. Special Projects and Studies, DATES

did.unittitle: Series I. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Assigned State Agencies, 1999-2010.

scopecontent.p: The Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Assigned State Agenices series is housed in 8 boxes and is arranged alphabetically by agency. Restricted material related to terrorism, personnel records, and administrative investigations has been sealed but not removed. This series contains correspondence, along with supporting material such as agendas, reports, policies, and presentations. The following state agencies and boards operated under the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety during the Kaine administration: Alcoholic Beverage Control Board, the Department of Correctional Education, Commonwealth's Attorneys' Services Council, the Department of Corrections, the Department of Criminal Justice Services, the Department of Emergency Management, the Department of Fire Programs, the Department of Forensic Science, the Department of Juvenile Justice, the Department of Military Affairs, the Virginia Parole Board, the Virginia State Police, and the Department of Veterans Services.

The correspondence files contain mostly correspondence between the agencies and the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety regarding issues that affect that particular agency or board. References to budgetary matters, litigation, studies and reports, board appointments, and legislation are frequently found in this material. These files also provide supporting documentation and background information on many topics.

Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, Dates.

scopecontent.p: The Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary series is housed in x boxes and is arranged into four subseries. Subseries have been designated for: A. Correspondence Files, B. Subject Files, C. Records of Deputy Secretary Barry Green, and D. Records of Deputy Secretary Dawn Smith.

did.unittitle: Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, Subseries A. Correspondence, 2002-2009.

scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the incoming and outgoing correspondence to the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety and covers the tenure of Secretary John Mashall from 2002 to 2010. Included are constituent corresondence and general correspondence. The correspondence and arranged alphabetically by first letter of last name and by date therein.

did.unittitle: Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, Subseries B. Subject Files, 2001-2009.

scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the subject files of the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety and covers the tenure of Secretary John Mashall from 2002 to 2010. Included are lists of Secretary of Public Safety accomplishments for 2002, 2004, 2007 and 2008; disaster designation letters and update; Forensic/DNA notificatio process; gubernatorial incapacity and succession; Homeland Security; Inmate telephone system; Hurricane Katrina; Medal of Valor award; and Public Safety agency head meetings (2002-2008). The files arranged alphabetically by subject.

Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, Subseries C. Records of Deputy Secretary Barry Green, 1998-2005.

scopecontent.p: This subseries is housed in 4 boxes and is arranged alphabetically by agency or subject. It contains correspondence and subject files kept by Deputy Secretary of Public Safety Barry Green during the administration of Governor Mark R. Warner (2002-2006). This series contains correspondence, email printouts, budget documents, news articles, reports and studies, memorandums, decision briefs, executive orders, and legislation.

Series II. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, Subseries D. Records of Assistant Secretary Dawn Smith, xxxx-xxxx.

scopecontent.p: This subseries is housed in 2 boxes and is arranged alphabetically by agency or subject. It contains correspondence and subject files kept by Assistant Secretary of Public Safety Dawn Smith during the administration of Governor Mark R. Warner (2002-2006). This series contains correspondence, email printouts, budget documents, news articles, reports and studies, memorandums, decision briefs, executive orders, and legislation.
